item.title: Squid Game and Call of Duty Black Ops 6 Collab is Coming in January
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/squid-game-call-of-duty/

It has been announced that a Squid Game x Call of Duty Black Ops 6 collaboration will be coming in January.

The collaboration was announced on the official X (formerly Twitter) Call of Duty account, where the account said, “An invite you can’t ignore. Netflix Squid Game comes to Call of Duty this January.”

Squid Game Season 2 premieres on Netflix on December 26, 2024, and the third and final season will be available sometime in 2025. Netflix predicted that by October 2021, Squid Game generated approximately $900 million US in value for the company, with the series only costing $21.4 million to produce.

Call of Duty’s announcement that the collaboration will come in January suggests that it’s likely to drop in the mid-season update for Black Ops 6 Season 1, which is often referred to as the “reloaded” update, which typically comes with new multiplayer maps and game modes.

It’s unclear what exactly the Squid Game and Call of Duty collaboration could entail, but it’s likely to involve new weapons and character skins. Alternatively, Call of Duty and Netflix could do something a little more special with the collaboration this time around, possibly a new party-type game mode.

What do you think the Squid Game and Call of Duty Black Ops 6 collaboration will look like? Let us know on the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that PlayStation has added new celebratory themes to PS5

item.title: Virtus.pro Eliminated From Shanghai Major by Amouranth’s Esports Team
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/virtus-pro-eliminated-shanghai-major-amouranth-team/

Virtus.pro was just forcefully ejected from the Shanghai Major by Wildcard, the esports organisation co-owned by Amouranth. In a crushing defeat, Virtus.pro failed to gain traction against the underdog side that is also facing elimination.

It was a particularly sour loss for Virtus.pro, given that the team is made up of champion-grade players but failed to secure a meaningful win during the opening stage of the Shanghai Major.

Poor Show

Virtus.pro will be heading home with just $10,000 in winnings, which won’t go a long way towards covering the costs of getting to Shanghai in the first place. It was a struggle from start to finish for Virtus.pro, with the team managing to secure just one win – and that was against Rare Atom, a bottom-table Chinese side with short legs in the game.

Rare Atom’s biggest claim to fame in this event is that the team sent Fnatic packing. The European organisation lost against Wildcard, Cloud9, and finally Rare Item, failing to secure a single point before being ejected from the tournament.

Virus.pro is the latest team to leave the competition in Shanghai, and the team is facing some ridicule on social media because the ultimate loss came at the hands of Wildcard, a team co-owned by Amouranth, the scandalous, controversial content creator. In June, Amouranth secured a significant ownership stake in the North American organisation.

The remaining matches in the opening stage of the Shanghai Major will wrap tomorrow, and then from December 5, the elimination stage will unravel. This round features some of the biggest names in CS2 esports, and it will end with just eight teams making it into the playoff stage, fighting for the $500,000 grand prize.

Have you been watching the Shanghai Major? Let us know on the Insider Gaming forum.

Stay tuned to Insider Gaming for the latest esports news

Subscribe to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Warzone Season 1 Reloaded update: Release date, new weapons, Ranked Play & more
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/warzone-season-1-reloaded-patch-notes/

Warzone Season 1 is about to get a fresh mid-season update filled with new content. As with every major update for the free-to-play battle royale, the update will not only bring new weapons and events, but players can also expect huge buffs and nerfs to shuffle the meta.

The update comes during the Holiday season, so if you’re looking to dive into Warzone over the Christmas period, here’s when the Season 1 Reloaded update is expected to drop.

  • Warzone Season 1 Reloaded release date
  • New weapons in Warzone Season 1 Reloaded
  • Ranked Play arrives in Warzone Season 1 Reloaded
  • Warzone Season 1 Reloaded expected content

Warzone Season 1 Reloaded release date

The Warzone Season 1 Reloaded update will arrive on December 5, 2024, at around 10 AM PT / 1 PM ET / 6 PM GMT.

Although it has not yet been confirmed, we are confident in this date as Treyarch announced that the new Zombies map for Black Ops 6, Citadelle des Morts, would arrive on December 5. In the CoD blog, this new map was confirmed to be released with the mid-season update, so we expect it to coincide with the official Season 1 Reloaded patch.

New weapons in Warzone Season 1 Reloaded

  • Maelstrom
  • AMR Mod 4
  • Cleaver

The Maelstrom is a new Shotgun arriving in Warzone Season 1 Reloaded, while the AMR Mod 4 is a semi-automatic Sniper Rifle that packs a mean punch. Players will also be able to get the Cleaver, a new Melee Weapon.

All three of these weapons will be available via an event, similar to the Power Drill and Sirin 9mm. We don’t yet know what this event is, but considering the update is arriving in the Holiday season, perhaps it will be Christmas-themed.

We’ll have to wait and see exactly how players unlock these new weapons when the event rolls around in Season 1 Reloaded.

Ranked Play arrives in Warzone Season 1 Reloaded

As promised by the devs, Ranked Play will return in Warzone with the Season 1 Reloaded update. It was removed after the Black Ops 6 integration in Season 1, but the devs are reintroducing it at the halfway point of the season.

The Ranked Play format will likely be very similar to what it was prior to the BO6 integration. Just like in multiplayer, players will earn Ranked Points by playing well and placing high. You will climb up Skill Divisions and earn exclusive Ranked Play rewards depending on the level you reach – Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum, Diamond, Crimson, Iridescent, and Top 250.

Black Ops 6 players have been enjoying Ranked Play in multiplayer, but it’s time for battle royale players to have their own competitive fun.

Warzone Season 1 Reloaded expected content

  • New guns
  • New events
  • Ranked Play
  • Buffs and nerfs

On top of new guns, events, and Ranked Play, we also expect Warzone Season 1 Reloaded to bring some hefty buffs and nerfs for the game’s weapons and equipment. Major updates often bring meta-shifting balance changes, but we won’t receive the official patch notes detailing these tweaks until closer to the update.

Are you looking forward to the Warzone Season 1 Reloaded update? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

If you want more on Call of Duty, be sure to also check out our guides on how to unlock the Buffer Weight Stock and how to get the Veteran Perk in BO6.
